Description: Silver finger-ring; heavy, stirrup-shaped with slightly convex oval bezel; hoop rounded on outer and flat on inner face; bezel with an Egyptian hieroglyphic inscription with invocation of Ptah and Ra-Horakhty and naming the king Nefer-Kheperu-re (Akhenaten).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: No. 2/18 (James, T.G.H. 1997. Ancient Egyptian Seals. in D. Collon (ed.) 7000 Years of Seals. British Museum Press. Pp. 31-46.)
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (997)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 308)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 48)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.17-8,36, Pl IV)
